'RIP Test cricket': Ex-IND player's furious take; triggers debate on Eden Gardens surface
description: Eden Gardens' pitch drew sharp criticism during the India-South Africa Test, with many deeming it unsuitable for the format.  Former cricketers like Harbhajan Singh and Michael Vaughan expressed dismay. However, Ravichandran Ashwin defended the surface, attributing batting struggles to technique rather than conditions, highlighting Temba Bavuma's resilience. South Africa were reduced to 93/7 by stumps on Day 2 in their second innings.

title: Make America Grate Again: Trump vs MTG in epic MAGA maelstrom after she tries to maim H1b visas

This public spat highlights growing divisions within the MAGA movement, with Greene defiant and Trump threatening political repercussions.

IPL 2026 Retention: Retained and released players with purse remaining for all IPL teams - full list
description: KKR and CSK will headline the bidding wars at the IPL 2026 mini-auction on December 16 in Abu Dhabi, with the biggest purses in hand. KKR, armed with Rs 63.4 crore after releasing high-value names including Venkatesh Iyer and Andre Russell, aim for a major squad overhaul. CSK, having freed up Rs 40 crore, are set to rebuild their bowling department and could chase Pathirana or Stokes. A busy trading window saw marquee moves like Ravindra Jadeja to RR, Sanju Samson to CSK, and Mohammed Shami to LSG, adding further intrigue to the auction pool. All released players will now enter the mini-auction pool.

title: Gronk’s one-day Patriots contract sparks debate: Will he get a Super Bowl ring?
description: Rob Gronkowski signed a one-day contract to retire as a Patriot, but his surprise exchange with Robert Kraft has sparked a real question. If New England makes a Super Bowl run, could Gronk actually receive a ring? Here’s the factual breakdown of his contract, league rules, and why the final decision falls entirely on Kraft.

title: 5 stories you must read today, November 15: From J&K police station blast linked to Red Fort plot to Zohran Mamdani’s push for Starbucks boycott and more
India’s undergrad applications to US colleges fall; data shows 14% decline
description: India’s undergraduate applications to U.S. colleges dropped 14% in the Common App’s 2025–26 cycle, one of the sharpest declines among major international sources. Overall international applications fell 9%, driven by decreases across Asia and Africa, including a 43% drop from Ghana. Only Vietnam and Uzbekistan saw growth. Meanwhile, domestic applicants rose 7%, with increases among Black, first-generation, fee-waiver-eligible, and rural students. Test-score reporting also climbed, even as underrepresented groups remained less likely to submit scores.

India's disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Ravindra Jadeja's four wickets, reduced South Africa to 93 for 7, protecting a slender lead. A crucial wicket came from Pant's tactical suggestion to Kuldeep Yadav, showcasing his sharp instincts.

The 23-year-old, a key offensive player with 10 goals this season, left Friday's game and did not return. His absence raises concerns about the team's scoring depth and line rotations as they await updates on his condition.

India had earlier been bowled out for 189, with Marco Jansen and Simon Harmer taking seven wickets between them. Jadeja's 4/29, supported by Kuldeep Yadav's 2/12, has India firmly in control.

The ghost of 'jungle raj': How Lalu Yadav defined Bihar election results
description: Despite Lalu Prasad Yadav's physical absence from the Bihar election campaign, his legacy profoundly shaped the results. The NDA successfully leveraged the 'jungle raj' narrative, resonating with voters seeking stability. While the RJD retained its core support, its broader appeal diminished, highlighting the enduring, albeit complex, influence of Lalu's historical impact on Bihar's political landscape.

'Taught to over-deliver,' says Andrew McCaskill: what professionals must learn
description: LinkedIn expert Andrew McCaskill warns that many U.S. employees become “accidentally indispensable” by over-delivering, helping colleagues, and taking on extra work without recognition. His advice is to seek clarity, set boundaries, and document contributions. By using strategies like the “Yes, and…” approach and pushing back thoughtfully, professionals can protect their well-being while turning their importance into career growth.

Berkshire Hathaway reveals 'Google secret' in Warren Buffett's final weeks as CEO
description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has made a significant $4.3 billion investment in Alphabet, Google's parent company, marking a rare move into a tech giant. This substantial stake, acquired in the third quarter, was disclosed just weeks before Buffett's planned CEO transition. The investment is seen by some as a potential signal of the next generation's investment philosophy at Berkshire.

title: 'Exit polls undermined LJP(RV)': Chirag dismisses rift rumours with JD(U); flays surveys
description: Chirag Paswan, LJP(RV) chief, refuted claims of discord between his party and Nitish Kumar's JD(U) during the Bihar elections, calling it a 'false narrative'. He highlighted his party's strong performance, exceeding exit poll predictions, and praised Nitish Kumar's determined campaigning. Paswan also criticized the opposition's language and their post-result blame game, emphasizing NDA's unity and commitment to Bihar's aspirations.

title: ‘Sunny Deol, Bobby Deol are scared of me, they don’t sit with me’: When Dharmendra talked about being friends with his children, said his father felt the same
Crisis brewing? How Pak is dismantaling its judiciary - and giving more power to Munir
description: Pakistan's judiciary faces a crisis as senior judges resign following a controversial constitutional amendment. This change centralizes power, creating a new Federal Constitutional Court and elevating the army chief to Chief of Defence Forces with extended tenure. Critics decry the move as an attack on judicial independence and civilian oversight, potentially impacting ongoing legal cases.

'Quitting politics': Rohini Acharya 'disowns' Lalu family day after RJD's Bihar poll debacle
description: Following a significant electoral setback for the Mahagathbandhan, Lalu Prasad's daughter, Rohini Acharya, announced her departure from politics and disowned her family. She claimed this decision was prompted by Sanjay Yadav and Rameez, taking full responsibility for the outcome. Acharya's statement on X has sparked considerable discussion regarding the party's future direction.

title: India second largest importer of Russian crude oil in October
description: Despite US objections, India continues to be a major buyer of Russian crude oil, ranking second globally in October with $2.5 billion in purchases. This trend persists as Western nations urge limitations on imports financing Russia's war in Ukraine. China remains the top buyer of Russian fossil fuels overall.

Security forces demolished his family home in Pulwama as part of a crackdown on terror modules procuring vehicles and chemicals. Authorities also attached the home of a separatist leader suspected to be in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

Delhi car blast: Cops uncover 'deeper conspiracy'; doctor module used ‘spycraft’ tactics
description: Delhi Police has filed a new FIR to investigate a deeper conspiracy behind the car blast near Red Fort. This follows an earlier FIR transferred to the NIA. The special cell is invoking criminal conspiracy charges and anticipates making arrests shortly. Intelligence sources noted the blast's intensity from new CCTV footage.

title: 5 common medicines that can damage kidneys and what are the alternatives
description: Millions in India face chronic kidney disease, with drug-induced damage a significant concern. Common medications like NSAIDs, antibiotics, and contrast agents can harm kidneys, especially with long-term use or in vulnerable individuals. Understanding these risks and consulting doctors is crucial for prevention.

Red Sox Eye $53M Reds Star as Wilyer Abreu Becomes Key Trade Chip
description: Boston Red Sox are reportedly eyeing Cincinnati Reds' ace Hunter Greene in a major trade. The proposed deal sees Greene and Jose Trevino heading to Boston, while the Reds would receive outfielder Wilyer Abreu and prospects Franklin Arias and Jhostnyxon Garcia. This move aims to bolster Boston's rotation and address Cincinnati's offensive needs.

title: IPL 2026 | RCB full list of retentions, released players; remaining purse for champs
description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, fresh off their maiden IPL title in 2025, are gearing up for the 2026 season with a reinforced core.  Their championship run showcased a shift towards collective effort over individual brilliance.  The team now focuses on building upon this successful foundation, retaining key players and integrating promising young talent for another strong campaign.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
description: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.

title: Heart health: Not just medicines, but this is the number one food to prevent arterial plaque
description: High blood pressure stands out as one of the known markers behind heart damage and disease. Clinical research has revealed that sipping beetroot juice can trigger a dip in blood pressure within a few hours, marking it as a surprisingly effective natural option, for managing hypertension. The underlying mechanism lies in nitrates, which boost nitric oxide production, prompting vessels to relax and reducing resistance

title: GM to suppliers: Find alternatives to China; America’s largest carmaker sets deadline
description: General Motors is directing thousands of suppliers to remove China-sourced parts and raw materials from their supply chains, aiming for complete divestment by 2027. This move, intensified by deepening U.S.-China trade hostilities and President Trump's policies, seeks to enhance supply chain resiliency. Carmakers are accelerating efforts to unwind decades-old sourcing ties due to ongoing geopolitical and economic wrangling.

title: How did Cody Beef Franke die? Inside the tragic end of the Barstool Sports star
description: Cody "Beef" Franke, a beloved personality on Barstool Sports' Fore Play golf podcast, has tragically passed away at 31 following a sudden medical event. Known for his infectious humor and passion for golf, Franke was a former PGA professional who joined Barstool in 2025.
